name: ITP approved for use by: Jon De Castro
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: LV & Signalling: 100Ø (114mm OD), orange electrical heavy duty 5.9mm wall thickness
○ LV & COMMS CONDUITS TO HAVE A MIN 600mm BENDING RADIUS
○ Inspect materials upon delivery and attached delivery dockets.
FREQUENCY: Each Material Type, Each Delivery
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Attach Material Conformnace Certs, Attach delivery dockets
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings VRIOGS 012.2.1 Section 6.15-16, VRIOGS 012.2.1 Section 6.9, VRIOGS 012.2.1 Cl.6.7 (c), L1-CHE-SPE-070 Cl.10 AS1289
○ Pits located within 1.5m of nearest rail, pit to be 300LA Railway loading
○ Pits 900x900mm or greater, multipart pits lids to be used.
○ Pit Covers shall comply with AS3996-2006
○ Pit lids in trafficable areas to be Class D, non-trafficable areas to be Class C.
○ LV, Comms Cover: pit covers shall be labelled with the words “RAILWAYS SIGNALS & COMMUNICATIONS” (L1-CHE-STD-043 14.6)
○ Inspect materials upon delivery and attached delivery dockets.
FREQUENCY: Each Material Type, Each Delivery
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Attach Material Conformnace Certs, Attach delivery dockets

FREQUENCY: Each Material Type, Each Delivery

○ Inspect materials upon delivery and attached delivery dockets.

VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Attach Material Conformnace Certs, Attach delivery dockets
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings L1-CHE-STD-043 Section 2 Table 1
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material free of rocks that will not pass a 30mm sieve. The material shall be free or organic matter or anything that could dmanage the conduits.
FREQUENCY: Each Material Type, Each Delivery
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Attach Material Conformnace Certs, Attach delivery dockets
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding Sand shall be a clean sand that is an uncrushed fine aggregate to AS2758.1 and shall have a thermal resistivity ≤ 1.2 °Cm/W at 5% moisture content.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All services within 5m of Excavation location have been identified and appropriate control in place (refer to MRPA Excavation Permit).
○ Survey to mark out existing services.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of works
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: WAP to be reviewed and signed by all relevant stakeholders along with Rail Safety highlighting works proedure with in the Rail Corridor
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of works
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Survey to set out trench alignment and pits, and establish construction control (alignment and level).
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check the revision of the IFC drawings are current as per the drawing register (on Teambinder)
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of works and at regualr intervals
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings L1-CHE-SPE-070 7.3 Table 2, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070 7.1c
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Trench profile and depth as per IFC drawings.
○ Edge of trenching to be a min. 2m from strucutres/pile foundation (unless it is mounting the structure) and a min. 4m from the rail for HV and 3m from the rail for LV & Comms
○ The bottom of the cable trench shall be level across its width and free from any protrusions and rubble that could cause damage to the conduits.
○ The width of the trench shall be not less than 200 mm (chain or bucket excavation) or 300 mm (backhoe and other).
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070 IFC Drawings MRPA Standards
5.3 Placement of Bedding Sand for Conduits
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: 100mm of bedding sand/crusher dust to be places at the base of trench.
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070, L1-CHE-STD-077
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Conduits are configured in accordance with IFC drawings and meet cable separation requirements.
– 1200mm Under VicRoads Roads & top of Rail
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070, L1-CHE-STD-077 IFC Drawings
– HV: Min. seperation distance between HV conduits at least 50mm
– Rail: When conduits are within 2.1m of edge of sleeper they must be encased in stab sand or cover is to be increase to 1.2m
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070 IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All conduit joints shall be made by utilising the spigot and socket ends.
○ Ends to be joined shall be thoroughly cleaned using a solvent approved by the conduit manufacturer.
○ The joint shall be impervious to water and shall be glued with an adhesive approved by the conduit manufacturer.
○ Socket ends to be placed firmly into the spigots then hit with a mallet to ensure a sound connection
FREQUENCY: Each Joint in each trench
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Provision shall be made for inspection of cable routes by NA, MTM/VicTrack representatives prior to backfilling.
RESPONSIBILITY: SE / PE MTM / VicTrack Rep.
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070 CL13.1 IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding sand/crusher dust extends 50mm past edge of conduits.
○ Bedding sand/crusher dust extends 100mm above conduits.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Warning Tape installed a min. 300mm above top conduit or a min. 300mm above HV protection barrers.
○ Tape to be one continuous length.
○ VicTrack to inspect the Marker Tape placement..
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings L1-CHE-STD-043 clauses 6.15 and 6.16
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill per trench profile
○ conduits under water ways to have 800mm cover from base of water way and backfilled with 3% stab sand
○ The trench shall be finished with a slight mound, height equal to approximately 25% of trench width, to provide for further settlement.
○ Trenches under road pavement - backfill to be same material as the road formation material.
○ Trenches immediately adjacent to footing shall be 3% stab sand. To be thoroughly placed to fill all voids without placing undue strain on or cause displacement of conduits.
○ When conduits are within 2.1m of edge of sleeper they must be encased in stab sand or cover is to be increase to 1.2m
○ VicTrack to be notified and witness the first layer of backfilling.
5.11 Signalling Pits, LV Pits, Electrolysis Pits, SCADA Pits, MTM Comms Pits
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: intervals no greater than 400m (electrolysis 190m)
○ Footpaths and non traffiacl areas, Class C Lids
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Access tracks to pits
○ Safe access and egress (i.e. lid doesn't open up with workers back to the rail)
○ Hand rail & retaining wall installed as required
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: 150mm of crushed rock under pit extending 500mm past the pit
○ Drainage arrangements shall be provided at the base of each pit.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pit to be parallel to track and parallel to conduit route.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pit installed to design specifications
○ Pit chamber floor to be 100mm lower than the underside of the lowest conduit.
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070 IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Lowest conduit 100mm from the pit chamber floor.
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070 IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Warrning tracer wire for Vic Track routes to be drilled into pits and crimped off.
○ If tracer wire broken needs to Crimped
RESPONSIBILITY: SE/PE, MTM / Vic Track Rep

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All conduit ends in pits are to be correctly fitted with spigots to ensure that there are no sharp edges on the conduit; they are to be mounted flush with the pit wall and not touching any other spigots.
○ HV Conduit entering the pit shall extend a minimum of 150mm beyond the edge of the excavation and be fitted with Bell Mouths.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The draw wire shall be continuous for the complete length of the conduit run.
○ The draw wire shall have a minimum of 2 metres of slack within every pit.
5.20 Backfill and Compaction Testing (if applicable) arouns Pits
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070 IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill used around pit & pit lid to achieve 95% standard compaction in layers no more than 150mm layers
○ Sand within sand pits to be compacted in layers no more than 250mm layers
○ Backfill shall be compacted and level with the collar and surrounds for Trafficable Pits.
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070 IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Spare conduits to be sealed and to be included on survey report.
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070 IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pit labels Brass Label (30mm x 150mm)
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070 IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pit Number Brass Label (30mm x 150mm)
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-070_13.2, STD_E0169 and STD_E0170, AS 4799, STD G0003 and STD G0004
– points entering & leaving the rail corridor
– White posts with marker plates for conduit runs
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070 IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cable pulling to be witnessed by MTM/Vic Track and to be signed off.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All installed High Voltage Cables shall be legibly and indelibly marked with an appropriate identifying label at each end of the cable, and at any cable joints.
○ The label shall state the destination points of the cable and the name of the cable relevant to appropriate drawings
REFERENCE: L1-CHE-SPE-070, L1-CHE-STD-043, L1-CHE-STD-070 IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cable joints are installed correctly, with sufficient fault loops lengths & supported correctly in pits.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Survey report to include but not limited to:
– Conduits labelled as per trench profile
– Other significant points of the cable route
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Handover check completed for Testing and Commisioning.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Testing and Comminsiong to be completed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed.
